content:
• Monday, January 14, 2013
  • EXPR

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) ups its Q4 earnings and comparable sales guidance, citing a...

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) ups its Q4 earnings and comparable sales guidance, citing a stronger-than-expected holiday season. It now sees earnings of $0.72 to $0.74 per share, above previously projected earnings of $0.62 to $0.68 a share. The company estimates comparable sales to range from flat to an increase of 1%, compared with prior guidance of a decline in the low single-digit range. Shares +13.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 PM
  • SHCAY

    Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY bucks a strong market in Japan this morning and trades -3.9% after reports in...

    Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY bucks a strong market in Japan this morning and trades -3.9% after reports in the U.S. overnight said Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) was cutting its orders for panels from OTCPK:SHCAY and other suppliers due to weaker-than-expected sales for the iPhone 5.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 PM | 24 Comments
  • MFLX

    Multi-Fineline (NASDAQ:MFLX) -10.6% AH after stating it expects to report FQ1 (Dec. quarter)...

    Multi-Fineline (NASDAQ:MFLX) -10.6% AH after stating it expects to report FQ1 (Dec. quarter) revenue of $290M, above a $270.2M consensus, but cautioning gross margin was hurt at the end of the quarter by production cuts and an unfavorable mix. Moreover, the circuit board maker expects GM to decline further in FQ2 thanks to lower revenue (expected - the consensus is at $239.7M), and has forecast "break-even or slightly negative net earnings" (not expected - the consensus is at $0.43). MFLX gets a large chunk of its sales from Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • DDC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: HWD +3%. BGC +3%. GTAT +3%. ESI-OLD +2%. MHO +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: HWD +3%. BGC +3%. GTAT +3%. ESI-OLD +2%. MHO +2%.
    After-hours top losers: LULU -7%. ITMN -5%. GMAN -4%. VNM -3%. UA -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • GBDC

    Golub Capital (NASDAQ:GBDC) takes advantage of a nice run with a 4.5M share secondary offering....

    Golub Capital (NASDAQ:GBDC) takes advantage of a nice run with a 4.5M share secondary offering. Combined with an additional 675K shares offered to the underwriters, it could add 20% to the float. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)Â 

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • MWE

    Mark West Energy (NYSE:MWE) -1.9% AH after filing for an offering of nearly 20M common units on...

    Mark West Energy (NYSE:MWE) -1.9% AH after filing for an offering of nearly 20M common units on behalf of selling unitholders. MWE will receive no proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) cuts Q4 loss guidance to $0.70 - $0.80 per share, versus previous...

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) cuts Q4 loss guidance to $0.70 - $0.80 per share, versus previous estimates of a loss of $0.61, due to flat premium store sales. The company blames the shortfall on holiday results that were negatively impacted by weak traffic in both early November and early December, due largely to macro-economic issues impacting customer shopping behavior. Shares -13% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • GCOM

    Globecomm (NASDAQ:GCOM) +5.6% AH after announcing it has hired Needham to "review potential...

    Globecomm (NASDAQ:GCOM) +5.6% AH after announcing it has hired Needham to "review potential strategic alternatives." The satellite services firm adds it now expects FY13 (ends June 30) revenue of $320M-$340M and EPS of $0.66-$0.71; the former is below a $364M consensus, but the latter is largely above a $0.66 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) -8.1% AH after stating it expects FQ4 (ends Feb. 3) revenue to be at the...

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) -8.1% AH after stating it expects FQ4 (ends Feb. 3) revenue to be at the high end of an original guidance range of $475M-$480M, and EPS to come in at $0.74; the latter is in-line, but the former is below a consensus of $489M. The yoga apparel retailer adds gross margin is "running slightly ahead of plan," and that it has a "clean inventory position." With shares having closed at 32x FY14E EPS, investors aren't in a forgiving mood.Â  (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • PTE

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $26.6M (+6% Y/Y)beats...

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $26.6M (+6% Y/Y)beats by $2.6M. Shares -10.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Though Dell's (DELL-OLD +12.9%) $5B in cash/investments and Michael Dell's 15.7% stake make a...

    Though Dell's (DELL-OLD +12.9%) $5B in cash/investments and Michael Dell's 15.7% stake make a P-E buyout easier, buyers would still need to come up with over $20B in financing (the majority of it probably debt) to make a deal happen, thinks the WSJ's Dennis Berman. Figures like that were only reached during P-E's 2006-07 heyday, and even then the deals involved very stable companies. Dell's exposure to a PC business suffering badly from share loss and tablet cannibalization presents a clear element of risk. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett (BBG -5.4%) is cut to Hold from Buy with a $17 target price, down from $19, at...

    Bill Barrett (BBG -5.4%) is cut to Hold from Buy with a $17 target price, down from $19, at Canaccord, due to a ~20% reduction in capital spending, ~10% higher per unit operating expense and a 250 bps increase inÂ its equity discount rate to 17.5%. Also, BBG's Uinta play requires a $115-$120 NYMEX oil price to generate the same ~10% return as other major oil plays get at $100.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SPWR

    SunPower (SPWR -6.3%) heads into the close with a steep loss following a downgrade to Sell from...

    SunPower (SPWR -6.3%) heads into the close with a steep loss following a downgrade to Sell from CLSA. The firm cites the solar module vendor/project developer's valuation and balance sheet - SunPower had $827M in debt as of Sep. 29, partly offset by $691M in cash/investments. The company announced after the close on Friday it would take a larger-than-expected restructuring charge.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • BKD

    Brookdale Senior Living (BKD +2.8%) gets a boost today from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at...

    Brookdale Senior Living (BKD +2.8%) gets a boost today from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Sidoti with a $32 price target. Once all the politics have been hashed out, clarity on rate cuts and expansion of coverage due to changes in health care laws means more customers and growth long term growth prospects prospects for the health care industrty, and BKD is going to be one of its prime beneficiaries.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • MILL

    Miller Energy (MILL -4.4%) says a horizontal well drilled in Tennessee's Mississippian-age Fort...

    Miller Energy (MILL -4.4%) says a horizontal well drilled in Tennessee's Mississippian-age Fort Payne formation flowed oil in a production test. MILL is awaiting environmental permission to re-inject the formation with produced gas to continue to stimulate production; it expects yields of 200-225 boe/day on the well once the process begins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • INCY

    Incyte (INCY +6.8%) gains today after Lazard Capital upped the shares to Buy earlier with a $25...

    Incyte (INCY +6.8%) gains today after Lazard Capital upped the shares to Buy earlier with a $25 price target. Lazard says that INCY's myelofibrosis treatment Jakafi is now being prescribed by some doctors to patients with less-severe cases of the bone-marrow disorder, after a reluctance to treat earlier-stage patients in the past. The firm attributes the change to INCY teaching physicians to titrate the Jakafi dose, which leads to fewer side effects and improves comfort.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ +5.4%) is getting a lift from a Bloomberg report that Dell is in talks to go private....

    H-P (HPQ +5.4%) is getting a lift from a Bloomberg report that Dell is in talks to go private. The company has long been the subject of breakup speculation, as well as calls for an activist push along those lines. Shares were already up on the day thanks to a JPMorgan upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • FSM

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +4.5%) reports record production of 5.2M silver equivalent oz. for...

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +4.5%) reports record production of 5.2M silver equivalent oz. for 2012 and expects to produce 5.7M silver equivalent oz. in 2013, driven by the ramp-up of its San Jose mine in Mexico. Silver and gold production in 2012 ended 8% and 19% above guidance, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD +12.1%) soars after Bloomberg reports the struggling IT solutions provider is in...

    Dell (DELL-OLD +12.1%) soars after Bloomberg reports the struggling IT solutions provider is in talks with at least two P-E firms to go private. The talks are said to be preliminary, and could reportedly fall apart due to a failure to obtain financing or to determine a way to exit the investment in the future. With a market cap that's now at $21.2B, Dell is much bigger than your typical P-E target. But it also trades at ~5x estimated FY13 EPS after backing out net cash/investments. (Michael Dell in 2010)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 7 Comments
  • DDC

    While retailing luxury goods turns over more cash, mining diamonds can be more profitable, so...

    While retailing luxury goods turns over more cash, mining diamonds can be more profitable, so Harry Winston (HWD +5.4%) is getting out of the luxury retail business and returning to its mining roots. The sale means HWD is now cashed up for future purchases, and a deal to buy Rio Tinto’s (NYSE:RIO) 60% stake in the Diavik mine is “an obvious one" to consider if the price is right, CEO Robert Gannicott says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (SYNA +5.4%) has rallied following a Pac Crest upgrade to Outperform: the firm cites...

    Synaptics (SYNA +5.4%) has rallied following a Pac Crest upgrade to Outperform: the firm cites smartphone market share gains and growing sales to Samsung in particular, and sees a potential Galaxy S IV design win driving upside. Pac Crest downgraded Synaptics on Oct. 1, when shares were 21% lower.Â  The company has been expanding its product line (I, II) in an effort to lower its dependence on a declining notebook touchpad market. At CES, Synaptics showed off Sensa, a solution that lets tablets ignore unintentional thumb touches.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • CNX

    The news that a traditional coal company is investing twice as much in natural gas as in coal -...

    The news that a traditional coal company is investing twice as much in natural gas as in coal - Consol (CNX -0.9%) forecasts 2013 investment in natural gas development of $835M-$935M vs. net investment in coal operations of $410M-$520M - is pushing down shares of most other coal miners: BTU -2.3%, ACI -2.6%, ANR -4%, WLT -3.1%, JRCC -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 4 Comments
  • FWONA

    Shares of Starz (NASDAQ:STRZA) rise 9.7% in their Nasdaq debut after spinning off from Liberty...

    Shares of Starz (NASDAQ:STRZA) rise 9.7% in their Nasdaq debut after spinning off from Liberty Media (LMCA +1%). The company - which boasts about 55M subscribers for its Starz, Encore, and Movieplex channels - is considered by analysts to be a juicy target for a large media company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • MXIM

    Analog chipmaker/Samsung supplier Maxim (MXIM -2.5%) is off following a downgrade to Neutral...

    Analog chipmaker/Samsung supplier Maxim (MXIM -2.5%) is off following a downgrade to Neutral from Credit Suisse: the firm says it expects "a significant deceleration" in the mobile phone market (36% of Maxim's sales and a major growth driver) going forward, though it thinks healthy industrial/telecom equipment exposure will buffer the blow. Analog Devices (ADI +0.1%) and Xilinx (XLNX) have been upgraded to Outperform (I, II), but neither is moving much - in each case, CS likes the chipmaker's industrial/telecom infrastructure exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • FTEK

    Fuel Tech (FTEK +5.2%) moves up after saying it's received four air pollution control contracts...

    Fuel Tech (FTEK +5.2%) moves up after saying it's received four air pollution control contracts in China, along with additional orders in the U.S. and Europe. The first award is for an SNCR system on a cement kiln, while the other three are for 6 medium-sized coal-fired units that are being retrofitted with NOx reduction technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • SQNS

    Sequans (SQNS +4%) catches a bid after announcing SoftBank, which is planning to build a 4G...

    Sequans (SQNS +4%) catches a bid after announcing SoftBank, which is planning to build a 4G network based on the TD-LTE standard (supported by Sequans' baseband chips) has concluded a trial of the chipmaker's interference-rejection tech, and that solid performance gains were recorded. Shares of the money-losing baseband chipmaker have rallied sharply in recent weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • HL

    Midday top 10 gainers: AZK +33%. NEWL +25%. CBAN +20%. THTI +17%. ADEP +17%. BIOL +15%. HALO...

    Midday top 10 gainers: AZK +33%. NEWL +25%. CBAN +20%. THTI +17%. ADEP +17%. BIOL +15%. HALO +14%. CXPO +11%. FNP +10%. CTC +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OTCQB:TELK -22%. NTE -12%. APT -11%. EDMC -11%. MXT -9%. HGG -9%. SPRO -9%. CRUS -8%. CEDC -8%. CBMX -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • RIG

    Simmons analysts see "one glaring catalyst" that likely explains Carl Icahn’s attraction...

    Simmons analysts see "one glaring catalyst" that likely explains Carl Icahn’s attraction to Transocean (RIG +1.7%): the prospect of extracting or accelerating a cash distribution yield out of RIG now that the Gulf spill overhang has been largely mitigated. RIG has ~$14B in debt and $6B in cash on the books, which the firm says offers ample flexibility to draw back to a targeted cash balance ~$1.5B after the DoJ settlement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD +7.3%) trades higher after SEC filings reveal Eddie Lampert upped his stake...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD +7.3%) trades higher after SEC filings reveal Eddie Lampert upped his stake in the company by about 300K shares. The investor must be a fan of the new CEO - the man in the mirror - who is set to start pushing the buttons on February 2.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (XRTX +10%) rallies after activist firm Baker Street Capital discloses its stake is now...

    Xyratex (XRTX +10%) rallies after activist firm Baker Street Capital discloses its stake is now at 23%, and issues an open letter in which it: 1) Nominates 3 board members. 2) Calls on Xyratex to halt its big investments in HPC and cloud hardware solutions, as well as curtail SG&A spending. 3) Estimates the company is trading at only 2.2x the EBITDA produced by its core storage system and hard drive equipment ops (exc. cash). Xyratex rose on Friday in spite of providing disappointing guidance to go with its FQ4 beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4%) is higher after Bloomberg reports the company's submarine optical cable...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4%) is higher after Bloomberg reports the company's submarine optical cable unit has received buyout interest; the business is estimated by one firm to be worth $1.1B and to have a 40% market share. P-E firms Permira (previous) and PAI Partners are said to be weighing bids, as is French sovereign wealth fund FSI. Also, France Telecom (FTE) has said it makes "industrial sense" to own the business - there's a good chance the French government is playing a role here. Alcatel has reportedly hired an i-bank to explore sales for other businesses. (Nov. report)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 3 Comments
  • HALO

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +14%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperfrom at BMO Capital. The...

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +14%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperfrom at BMO Capital. The firm says meetings with management leave it increasingly confident in its pipeline, particularly the potential for a positive opinion for Herceptin SC in Q113. In addition, its recent collaboration with Pfizer (PFE +1%) will provide additional value drivers over the next 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • CXPO

    Crimson Exploration (CXPO +11.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus, which says...

    Crimson Exploration (CXPO +11.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus, which says underperformance over the past six months has created an attractive entry point below CXPO's liquidation value. The firm thinks the return of drilling in the Woodbine, expected startup of the Covington-Upchurch well, and release of 2013 guidance should help raise the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • TELK

    Telik (OTCQB:TELK -21%) reverses course and gives back a big chunk of its +55% gain posted on...

    Telik (OTCQB:TELK -21%) reverses course and gives back a big chunk of its +55% gain posted on Friday, after the company said its myelodysplastic syndrome treatment Telintra had been given an Orphan Drug designation by the FDA, which will give it U.S. market exclusivity for seven years. The stock is no stranger to volatility however, and Fridays move is just a drop in the bucket compared to the bigger picture for a stock that just less than a year ago had been trading at $8.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +1%) trades higher this morning after Lazard Capital ISRG) is higher...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +1%) trades higher this morning after Lazard Capital ISRG) is higher this morning after Lazard Capital upgraded the shares to Buy from Neutral." target="_blank">upgraded the shares to Buy from Neutral. The company's flagship da Vinci surgical system is an industry leader with very little competition solid sales growth. Margins are also impressive. For the first 9 months of 2012, ISRG had gross margins above 72%, operating margins above 40%, and net profit margins above 30%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • TAHO

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO -8.2%) reports the death of two security guards after a security patrol at...

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO -8.2%) reports the death of two security guards after a security patrol at its Escobal project in Guatemala was ambushed by armed criminals. Local news reports say the government is saying the incident was not a local protest but an organized incursion by a well-armed group.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • LMNX

    Luminex (LMNX -5.9%) slips this morning after Cowen cut the shares to Underperform, commenting...

    Luminex (LMNX -5.9%) slips this morning after Cowen cut the shares to Underperform, commenting in a note to clients that "competitive pressures have intensified" for it's molecular-diagnostics franchise. This, combined with a lack of significant near-term catalysts and a still-rich valuation, means it's likely to lag its peer group over the next 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • XXIA

    Ixia (XXIA +8.4%) shoots higher after raising its Q4 revenue guidance range to $123.5M-$124.5M...

    Ixia (XXIA +8.4%) shoots higher after raising its Q4 revenue guidance range to $123.5M-$124.5M from $118M-$122M; the consensus stands at $120.5M. The telecom test equipment hardware vendor adds it expects revenue from two recent acquisitions - Anue and BreakingPoint - to amount to $30M-$31M, above guidance of $26M-$28M. Rival EXFO (EXFO +4.9%) is up in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • FB

    Has Facebook's (FB -1.4%) big rally finally run out of steam? Shares are now lower in spite of a...

    Has Facebook's (FB -1.4%) big rally finally run out of steam? Shares are now lower in spite of a Deutsche upgrade and a bullish note from Oppenheimer's Jason Helfstein. Helfstein claims new comScore data indicates the pace of Facebook's U.S. PC traffic decline (due in large part to mobile cannibalization) is slowing, and that the ROI for FBX Exchange ads is 2x that of regular Marketplace ads. Facebook, which reports on Jan. 30, is trading at 48x 2013E EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • PURE

    Shares of PURE Bioscience (OTC:PURE +15.4%) jump this morning on a big burst of volume at the...

    Shares of PURE Bioscience (OTC:PURE +15.4%) jump this morning on a big burst of volume at the open after the company says its PURE Hard Surface disinfectant, an antimicrobial product for use in protecting against the latest strain of the flu, kills the virus within 30 seconds, and has a 24-hour residual protection capability. The efficacy against viruses exceeds that of even highly toxic chemicals, yet it's listed as fume-free EPA Category IV - least-toxic - product, which is ideal for use near children and in dense population environments.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • KATE

    Shares of Fifth & Pacific (FNP +9.9%) race higher after the company announces it expects...

    Shares of Fifth & Pacific (FNP +9.9%) race higher after the company announces it expects 2013 EBITDA of $120M-$150M, well-above its estimate for 2012 which it pegs at $100M-$105M. In Q4, sales of the retailer's Kate Spade brand grew 27% to help offset a 2% decline with Juicy Couture.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMVT

    Comverse (CMVT +6.9%) jumps on a report Nice Systems is in talks to buy rival Verint, which is...

    Comverse (CMVT +6.9%) jumps on a report Nice Systems is in talks to buy rival Verint, which is 41%-owned by Comverse. The reported $1.5B price tag would give Comverse a $98M gain for its stake relative to Friday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • BB

    While Apple slumps thanks to iPhone component order cut reports, Research In Motion (RIMM +8.3%)...

    While Apple slumps thanks to iPhone component order cut reports, Research In Motion (RIMM +8.3%) is continuing its recent tear; shares are now up 23% from Thursday's close and have fully recouped the giant losses seen following RIM's FQ3 report, which raised fears the company's services revenue will soon fall sharply. Short-covering and enthusiasm about the upcoming BlackBerry Z10 seem to be the main factors.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 6 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Early strength in Molycorp (MCP +2.2%) is attributed to a takeover story making the rounds...

    Early strength in Molycorp (MCP +2.2%) is attributed to a takeover story making the rounds highlighting the shares' recent fall below NAV which is turning the high-potential firm into a prime takeover target. Even after rebounding from a record low in November, MCP still trades at a 19% discount to their book value.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • CUR

    Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR) jumps 12.1% after it receives approval from the FDA to start a Phase I...

    Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR) jumps 12.1% after it receives approval from the FDA to start a Phase I safety trial of its lead cell therapy treatment, NSI-566, in eight patients who have become complete paralyzed due to spinal-cord injuries. Neuralstem has already conducted 18 successful surgeries using the same cells and surgical device that it will use in the new trial. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • AVNW

    Aviat Networks (AVNW +8.1%) jumps out of the gate after raising its FQ2 (Dec. quarter) revenue...

    Aviat Networks (AVNW +8.1%) jumps out of the gate after raising its FQ2 (Dec. quarter) revenue guidance to $123M-$126M from $115M-$120M - the consensus stands at $117M. The mobile backhaul equipment firm also expects orders to be higher than revenue. The pre-announcement comes shortly after rival DragonWave (DRWI -0.8%) missed Nov. quarter estimates and issued soft Feb. quarter guidance. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are dragged down by reports that Apple has slashed orders for...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are dragged down by reports that Apple has slashed orders for iPhone parts, with the S&P benchmark -0.15% and the Nasdaq -0.6%. Harry Winston Diamond is +11% following news it's selling its Harry Winston brand to Swatch, while Transocean is +3.3% after Carl Icahn buys a stake. However, hhGregg is -7.5% in the wake of a poor FQ3 preliminary earnings report. Later: Fed's Bernanke, Williams and Lockhart
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CRUS

    Unsurprisingly, iPhone chip suppliers are joining Apple in getting hit by the WSJ and Nikkei's...

    Unsurprisingly, iPhone chip suppliers are joining Apple in getting hit by the WSJ and Nikkei's order cut reports. CRUS -5%. QCOM -1.4%. BRCM -1.3%. SWKS -3.7%. TQNT -1.2%. AVGO -1.9%. Can Samsung (OTC:SSNLF - +1.2% in Seoul), which just announced 100M cumulative Galaxy S phone sales, pick up the apparent slack for some of these companies?

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 17 Comments
  • HL

    Premarket gainers: AZK +29%. CUR +14%. AVNW +13%. HWD +11%. VRNT +10%. NICE +8%. FIO +6%. FRAN...

    Premarket gainers: AZK +29%. CUR +14%. AVNW +13%. HWD +11%. VRNT +10%. NICE +8%. FIO +6%. FRAN +6%. DNDN +5%. ALU +6%.
    Losers: NTE -11%. CRUS -6%.Â 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • JCP

    Oppenheimer is out with a note defending J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP), saying the retailer can rebound...

    Oppenheimer is out with a note defending J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP), saying the retailer can rebound despite what's reported to be a disasterous holiday season. If a silver lining is to be found, the company's sales were stronger in the second half of December. JCP -1.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • FRAN

    What to make of Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN)? In the middle of a sluggish retail holiday season,...

    What to make of Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN)? In the middle of a sluggish retail holiday season, the boutique firm rode a "shallow merchandising" strategy and fresh e-commerce initiatives to strong results. Look for more from the retailer on its winning mix of growing sales while holding the line on margins as it presents this week at an investor conference. FRAN +9.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • HGG

    More on hhgregg's (NYSE:HGG) sales report: The company notes declining demand for flat screen...

    More on hhgregg's (NYSE:HGG) sales report: The company notes declining demand for flat screen TVs and a broadened distribution channel for large-screen TVs cut into store traffic and sales. As a result, the retailer's video category saw sales tail off 24.6% Y/Y. HGG -6.0% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 3 Comments
  • HGG

    hhGregg (NYSE:HGG) announces preliminary results for FQ3, saying total sales fell off 3.6% Y/Y...

    hhGregg (NYSE:HGG) announces preliminary results for FQ3, saying total sales fell off 3.6% Y/Y to $799.6M as comparable-store sales dropped 9.7%. The company says it earned $0.52 a share during the period, below the consensus mark of analysts calling for $0.59. For FY13, the retailer expects EPS of $0.70-$0.80 vs. prior guidance of $0.90-$1.05. Shares of HGG -6.1% premarket.

    Audio- and video-monitoring company Nice Systems (NICE +7.4%) is reportedly in talks to acquire rival Verint (VRNT +10.9%) for $1.5B in cash and stock in a deal that would represent a 19% premium on the latter's market cap of $1.26B.   • China could boost quotas for foreign investment in its capital markets by 9-10 times, says Guo...

    China could boost quotas for foreign investment in its capital markets by 9-10 times, says Guo Shuqing, the chairman of the China Securities Regulatory Commission. Such action would add to efforts last year to draw in more foreign long-term investors, including pension funds. Guo's remarks buoyed Chinese shares and helped send the Shanghai Composite Index up 3.1% to 2,311, its highest finish since June.
